sourcesContent:
import React, { Component } from "react"; class Form extends Component { constructor(props){ super(props); this.state = { id: '', name: '', coursenumber:'', easiness: '', contents: '', grade: '', book: '', attendance:'', classstyle: '', comments: '' } } onNameChange = (event) => { this.setState({name: event.target.value}) // updated signInEmail from } onCourseChange = (event) => { this.setState({coursenumber: event.target.value}) // updated signInEmail from } onGradeChange = (event) => { this.setState({grade: event.target.value}) // updated signInEmail from } handleContentsChange = changeEvent => { this.setState({ contents: changeEvent.target.value }); console.log(this.state.contents) }; handleOptionChange = changeEvent => { this.setState({ easiness: changeEvent.target.value }); console.log(this.state.easiness) }; handleBookChange = changeEvent => { this.setState({ book: changeEvent.target.value }); }; onSubmitForm =() => { fetch('http://localhost:3000/professors', { method: 'post', headers: {'Content-Type': 'application/json'}, body: JSON.stringify({ // Send email and password updated at "onEmailChange" and "onPasswordChange" to the database through JSON.stringify name: this.state.name, coursenumber:this.state.coursenumber, easiness: this.state.easiness, contents: this.state.contents, grade: this.state.grade, book: this.state.book, attendance:this.state.attendance, classstyle: this.state.classstyle, comments: this.state.comments }) }) .then(response => response.json()) // Get response through json, and get data by ".then" .then(user => { if (user.id) { this.props.loadUser(user); this.props.onRouteChange('signin'); } }) } render(){ return (
Rate Your Professor
); } } export default Form;
